vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
μωρ-αίνω,
future - ᾰνῶ [Refs 5th c.BC+]: aorist ἐμώρᾱνα [Refs 4th c.BC+] —passive, see below [Refs]: (μῶρος):—to be silly, foolish, drivel, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; play the fool, [Refs 4th c.BC+] make a mad attempt, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; οὐδεὶς.. ταῦτα μωραίνει indulges in these follies, [Refs 5th c.BC+]: euphemistic of illicit love, γυναῖκα μωραίνουσαν [Refs]
__II causal, make foolish, convict of folly, ἡ βουλὴ αὐτῶν μωρανθήσεται [LXX]; ἐμωράνθην σφόδρα[LXX+NT]:—passive, to become foolish, be stupefied, [αἶγες] ἑστᾶσιν ὥσπερ μεμωραμμέναι [Refs 4th c.BC+]; to become insipid, ἐὰν τὸ ἅλας μωρανθῇ [NT]
vocabInfos.shortDef: (act.) to make foolish, show one foolish; (pass.) to become a fool, be made a fool; (passive) to become saltless, tasteless, inert insipid
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
(act.) to make foolish, show one foolish; (pass.) to become a fool, be made a fool; (passive) to become saltless, tasteless, inert insipid
to be foolish, to play the fool;, in NT transitive to make foolish, convict of folly, 1Cor. 1:20; passive to be convicted of folly, to incur the character of folly, Rom. 1:22; to be rendered insipid, lose savour, be tasteless Mt. 5:13; Lk. 14:34*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: hacer tonto o necio ; hacer insípido, sin sabor (voz pasiva: perder el sabor)
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: khiến vô vị; không có vị gì; trở nên điên dại.
